Reviews.Title: “Stinks”
Reviews.Author: Anne L
Reviews.Content: We made the reservation through expedia. We were quoted a "CLC" price of $55.+tax. We were told yes to truck parking(we drive a semi), yes to micro/fridge in the room, yes to pets(no extra charge). We made the reservation. $142.00. The clerk wouldn't tell us the CLC rate at check-in( I was curious).....there was an extra fee for a pet $15.....and no micro/fridge in the room. Our clerk told us he "would bring them to us in a few minutes." UNbelievable! He showed up with a hand truck and the micro/fridge.....both were disgustingly grubby. The room was gross and smelled funky AND we didn't get the CLC price from expedia. NEVER again....I'd rather sleep under a freaking bridge!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: PinballLes
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel. Made a booking through the America's Best Value Inn website, requested a non-smoking room, arrived, tried multiple rooms, all stunk of cigarette smoke. Asked for a refund as the policy sign on the wall said they would give a refund if you were not happy with the room. Hotel manager refused to give us a refund. We cut our loss and stayed somewhere else where they take non-smoking seriously.

Reviews.Title: “Like to say again”
Reviews.Author: robert35805
Reviews.Content: I love to say again in this hotel. Nice and clean rooms. and nice peoples.

Reviews.Title: “like this place”
Reviews.Author: pappa2572
Reviews.Content: good location, excellent service, good staff. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Skip this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ofallongirl
Reviews.Content: I booked thi hotel as a place to stop for the night on a recent trip. I trusted the Days Inn name but this hotel is very rundown. The rooms are small and not the cleanest. The location and the other people at the hotel made me nervous. The place is located on East 21st street at the end of the "hotel row" The other properties nearby seemed in much better condition. I did notice a security vehicle from another property on the parking lot. The area warranted security. Overall avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “Should Be Shut Down!!!”
Reviews.Author: forksbear
Reviews.Content: I needed one night in a Trip Rewards program hotel while driving cross country. I arrived and was given a rather run-down room at the far end of the hotel that had no wireless internet signal whatsoever. Between that and noticing that two doors down was an apparent hotel live-in guest with friends present and the burning smell of "happy plant" in the air, I went back to the office and was told that I would need to be located near the front of the building in order to connect to the Internet. So, I switched rooms. The room was worse a dump than the first dumpy room. I still had no internet signal, but needed to connect to keep in touch with my employer. Back to the office I went. It turned out that the desk clerk had no idea which router Days Inn was using for me to connect to. Usually hotels have a router with their designated name, but this hotel had a store-purchased router that was still under the brand name and once I connected I was fine. However, during the course of the evening I became nervous when the tenants at the far back of the hotel near the room I had first checked into (quite apparently not guests, but actual hotel tenants) had traffic coming and going at all times of the night, I lost count after 23 visitors in the course of 6 hours. I'm no dummy, having grown up in the inner city as a child and seeing firsthand the types of activities that some of the neighbors were involved in, and this was clearly not a scenario of multiple friends dropping in constantly. Between the constant stream of visitors between 10 PM and dawn with their loud rap music thumping away, I got no sleep, and I had to constantly peer out of the curtains to be sure my rental car had not been stolen or damaged. I gladly checked out the next day and would never set foot onto this piece of property ever again! Filthy, run down, apparently catering to welfare housing clients, with a constant stream of incoming-outgoing visitors who were not registered guests. Scary place! I would have felt safer walking with a wallet full of bills in downtown Detroit at 3 in the morning. And....although all my other hotel stays around this time period credited my Trip Reward points to my account, to this very day the Days Inn has yet to submit my points to my account and I have had to register a complaint with the Trip Rewards program. I highly advise that if you need a place in Indianapolis to stay for an evening, keep driving right by this one!

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: baldknobbers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Days Inn on South Keystone Ave in Indianapolis (there is more than one Days Inn in Indy) Overall the room was okay. Very convenient to major highways. The manager was very helpful and provided us with maps and clear directions to where we wanted to go. There were a few oddities in the room: various holes in the walls, a dirty looking bathtub, and condoms in the nightstand bible. (Seriously, two brand new condoms were found in the book of Jerimiah!!) This place works well for those who are in town for a short period of time and who plan on spending most of the day/night sightseeing. A good value, but keep in mind the prices here will surely double or triple when the races are in town!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently remodeld if you call a coat of paint remodeling. Globby stains on the carpet, carpet filthy. Bathroom stains and burn marks all over. Old blankets and sheets. Don't stay there. Wish I had taken photos so all could see.
